citeinfo.title: Data Record of Oceanographic Observation & Exploratory Fishing - No. 6, 1962

descript.abstract: Meteorological observations: Every three-hour interval, covering the whole course. Data are not presented here in order to save the printing cost, they will gladly supply by direct communication upon request. - Hydrographic observations: at 52 stations throughout three cruises, 10-(1), 10-(2), 10-(3), covering depths from the surface down to 1000 meters. - Analysis of water samples: Chrorinity was estimated by titration method after from the cruise. - Plankton sampling: Vertical hauls with a fine mesh net, 30 cm x 150 cm, XX 13 from approximately 100 meter depth, once at each hydrographic station. From approximately 150 meter depth, once at each hydrographic station. Horizontal tows with a larva net, 130 cm X 450 cm stramin, through the surface layer for ten minutes at low speed at hydrographic stations and other stations: - Fish Larva sampling: From the mixed plankton samples collected with a 130 cm larva net. - Salmon grill-net set: Twenty-four operations were carried out throughout three cruises at different stations. Specimens were used to the measurement of biological characters, observations on maturity, sampling of scales for later examination.
descript.purpose: Purpose is to record of oceanographic observation & exploratory fishing - No.6, in March 1962

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
